activities.name: Schema Discovery From Databricks
activities.description: Discover all tables with DELTA data source format in the specified catalog (database) and schema.

dependsOn.activity: Check If We Should Rediscover Data

query.value:
SELECT
  '@{variables('DATASET')}' AS dataset,
  t.TABLE_CATALOG AS specified_database,
  t.TABLE_SCHEMA AS specified_schema,
  t.TABLE_NAME AS identified_table,
  c.COLUMN_NAME AS identified_column,
  c.DATA_TYPE AS identified_column_type,
  CASE
    WHEN c.FULL_DATA_TYPE LIKE 'varchar%' THEN substring(c.FULL_DATA_TYPE,9, POSITION(')' IN c.FULL_DATA_TYPE) - POSITION('(' IN c.FULL_DATA_TYPE) -1) 
    WHEN c.FULL_DATA_TYPE = 'string' THEN 500
    ELSE -1
  END AS identified_column_max_length,
  c.ORDINAL_POSITION AS ordinal_position
FROM
  @{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_CATALOG}.INFORMATION_SCHEMA.TABLES t
  JOIN @{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_CATALOG}.INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS c
    ON t.table_catalog = c.table_catalog AND t.table_schema = c.table_schema AND t.table_name = c.table_name
WHERE
  t.table_catalog = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_CATALOG}' AND t.table_schema = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_SCHEMA}' AND t.data_source_format = 'DELTA';

sqlReaderQuery.value:
SELECT DISTINCT
    specified_database,
    specified_schema,
    identified_table
FROM @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')}
WHERE
dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'
AND LOWER(specified_schema) = LOWER('@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_SCHEMA}')
AND LOWER(specified_database) = LOWER('@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_CATALOG}')
AND (discovery_complete IS NULL OR discovery_complete = 0)
ORDER BY identified_table

ifFalseActivities.name: Fail After Updating Discovery State Undiscoverable

activities.name: Check If We Should Rediscover Data

ifTrueActivities.name: Mark Tables Undiscovered
ifTrueActivities.description: Mark all tables in this database and schema as undiscovered so that we can re-discover sensitive data in them

text.value:
UPDATE @{variables('METADATA_SCHEMA')}.@{variables('METADATA_RULESET_TABLE')}
SET discovery_complete = CAST(0 AS BIT)
WHERE
    dataset = '@{variables('DATASET')}'
    AND specified_database = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_CATALOG}'
    AND specified_schema = '@{pipeline().parameters.P_SOURCE_SCHEMA}'

sources.name: Ruleset
sources.description: Get the ruleset table from the metadata store at DF_METADATA_SCHEMA.DF_METADATA_RULESET_TABLE

sinks.name: WriteToMetadataStore
sinks.description: Sink results to metadata data store by sinking the derived metadata and row count columns to the appropriate columns in the metadata store

transformations.name: FilterRowsToUpdate
transformations.description: Filter ruleset table down to the table in question by specifying dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, and identified_table - making sure they match the dataset associated with each version of the dataflow, DF_SOURCE_DATABASE, DF_SOURCE_SCHEMA, DF_SOURCE_TABLE, and not empty or null (respectively). This filters the ruleset down to only the information about this particular table

transformations.name: ChecksBeforeSave
transformations.description: Alter rows using Update if (only update rows that need updating)

transformations.name: UpdateProfiledColumns
transformations.description: Updating the columns row_count, metadata, and last_profiled_updated_timestamp

sources.name: Source1MillRowDataSampling
sources.description: Import the first million rows of unmasked data from the desired source dataset

sources.name: MetadataStoreRead
sources.description: Import data from Metadata Datastore, querying the ruleset table

sinks.name: WriteToMetadataStore
sinks.description: Sink results of profiling to metadata data store by sinking the unrolled results of the profiling call to the appropriate columns in the metadata store

transformations.name: CreateRandomIdColumn
transformations.description: Add a DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_RANDOM_ID column, which is generated via the random expression. The current timestamp in milliseconds is used as the seed for the number generation

transformations.name: SortByRandomId
transformations.description: Sort the sample rows based on the randomly generated IDs

transformations.name: CreateFinalSelectionId
transformations.description: Add a DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_FINAL_SELECTION_ID column that increments by 1 and starts at 1. It is incremented in order of the DELPHIX_COMPLIANCE_SERVICE_RANDOM_ID added previously, making it so that the surrogate key is in order of the randomly assigned value, creating a shuffled set of rows

transformations.name: GetRandomRows
transformations.description: Take the first DF_NUM_ROWS_TO_PROFILE from the shuffled row set

transformations.name: CreateItemsList
transformations.description: For every column that we didn't add collect it to produce a list of values, and encode the column name to avoid reserved characters

transformations.name: ParseAPIResponse
transformations.description: Parse the API response from profiling call

transformations.name: AssertNoFailures
transformations.description: Confirm that we received a 200 response status from the API request

transformations.name: FlattenDetails
transformations.description: Unroll the API response body into columnName, domain, algorithm, confidence, and rowsConsidered

transformations.name: FilterRowsToUpdate
transformations.description: Filter ruleset table down to the table in question by specifying dataset, specified_database, specified_schema, and identified_table - making sure they match the dataset associated with each version of the dataflow, DF_SOURCE_DATABASE, DF_SOURCE_SCHEMA, and DF_SOURCE_TABLE (respectively). This filters the ruleset down to only the columns that need to be profiled for this particular table

transformations.name: JoinDetailsAndMetadata
transformations.description: Inner join on FlattenDetails and FilterRowsToUpdate based on matching column names

transformations.name: ChecksBeforeSave
transformations.description: Alter rows using Update if (only update rows that need updating)

transformations.name: UpdateProfiledColumns
transformations.description: Updating the columns row_count, metadata, and last_profiled_updated_timestamp

transformations.name: FilterOnlyNewlyProfiledRows
transformations.description: Filter rows where the profiling results are different from previous dataflow executions (i.e. the profiled_domain, profiled_algorithm, rows_profiled, confidence_score or row_count have changed)

transformations.name: ItemsListWithRenamedColumns
transformations.description: Decode the encoded column name to restore it to the source column name

scriptLines: items as (details as (columnName as string, domain as string, algorithm as string, confidence as float, rowsConsidered as integer)[])),

ParseAPIResponse assert(expectTrue(toInteger(regexExtract(status, '(\\d+)', 1)) == 200, false, 'Failed_request', null, iif(isNull(body.message), status, concatWS(', ', 'timestamp: ' + toString(body.timestamp), 'status: ' + body.status, 'message: ' + body.message, 'trace_id: ' + body.trace_id))),
